text: One of the great things about travel is you find out how many good, kind people there are.
author: Edith Wharton

text: I would love you all the day, every night we would kiss and play, if with me you'd fondly stray, over the hills and far away.
author: John Gray

text: People travel because it teaches them things they could learn no other way.
author: Lance Morrow

text: At the root of Japanese manufacturing lies a feminine delicacy and shyness as well as a childlike curiosity and fantasy-filled worldview.
author: Morinosuke Kawaguchi

text: Whoever created the world went to a lot of trouble. It would be downright rude not to go out and see as much of it as possible.
author: Edward Readicker-Henderson

text: A (wo)men travels the world over in search of wht (s)he needs and returns home to find it
author: Barbara Magro

text: Don’t take everything for granted, and do not always count on finding everything you need.
author: Larry Herzberg

text: What he was after hangs between the visible and the invisible, between the here and now and the seemingly elsewhere.
author: André Aciman

text: A traveler's most interesting meals tend to happen by surprise.
author: David Dale

text: Contentment can only be found in not envying others or comparing yourself to them but in being satisfied with what you have.
author: Larry Herzberg

text: Poverty and loneliness could be seen as a liberation from strivings to become rich and popular.
author: Donald Richie

text: In Japan, so many emoticons have been created that it’s reasonable to assume Japanese appreciate their convenience more than anyone else.
author: Morinosuke Kawaguchi

text: Gift giving is part of the culture no matter where you are and no matter how long you stay.
author: Christalyn Brannen

text: Tokyo is a very safe city. At night it becomes quiet the way New York never does.
author: Rick Kennedy

text: There is a saying, if any stranger enquire of the first met of Maan, were it even a child, “Who is here the sheykh?” he would answer him “I am he.
author: Charles Montagu Doughty

text: One very good way to invite stares of disapproval in Japan is to walk and eat at the same time.
author: Andrew Horvat

text: Girly’ products can spur Japan’s growth in this century every bit as much as, if not more than, the ‘manly’ technologies.
author: Morinosuke Kawaguchi

text: In Chinese business culture, humility is a virtue.
author: Stefan H. Verstappen

text: When given the chance to see China off the beaten track, definitely take it.
author: Larry Herzberg

text: When you’re in another country, remember to do as the locals do, since it is your ways that may seem strange of offensive to them.
author: Tracey Wilen

text: The sacrifices of time and money that Chinese friends will make for one another often go far beyond what is expected or accepted in Western society.
author: Larry Herzberg

text: The pleasure we derive from journeys is perhaps dependent more on the mindset with which we travel than on the destination we travel to.
author: Alain de Botton

text: Travel doesn't become adventure until you leave yourself behind.
author: Marty Rubin

text: There are countries of the world, and regions of one's own mind, where it is unwise to travel.
author: Chris Cleave

text: Anticipation. In love and travel, getting there is half the fun. The lustful impatience, the passionate daydreams, the nerve-wracking
author: Vivian Swift

text: You have to taste a culture to understand it.
author: Deborah Cater

text: We are homeless enough in this world under the best of circumstances without going to any special effort to test our capacity to be more so.
author: Harold Edmund Stearns

text: There are no tips for life neither for travelling
author: Guido Colombo

text: What an absurdity to go and bury oneself in South America, where they are always having revolutions.
author: Agatha Christie

text: The most amazing travellers were to humble to write about it
author: Guido Colombo

text: The red sands of Marrakesh, sprawling at the foot of the Atlas like a wounded Leviathan....
author: Rosita Forbes

text: If you travel everywhere and find the same elements everywhere, somehow it reduces the value of the place (Curiosity, Tokyo, Japan)
author: Editorial Board of Approaching Hotel Designers

text: To live is to travel, on a voyage more epic than the odysseys of myth - not from place to place, but through the poignant strangeness of time.
author: T.L. Rese

text: Today..passes as yesterday, today is passing by... Tomorrow shall become today and that too shall pass!
author: Escapades

text: Your past experiences will flavour your future ones, that is human nature.
author: Deborah Cater

text: ...books were better than travel.
author: Pseudonymous Bosch

text: When you're traveling, you are what you are, right there and then. People don't have your past to hold against you. No yesterdays on the road.
author: William Least-Heat Moon

text: I've met the most interesting people while flying or on a boat. These methods of travel seem to attract the kind of people I want to be with.
author: Hedy Lamarr

text: Journeys are the midwives of thought. Few places are more conducive to internal conversations than moving planes, ships or trains.
author: Alain de Botton

text: We wandered in a frenzy and a dream (301).
author: Jack Kerouac

text: A little crazy is good
author: Chris Hilton

text: India will reveal to you the places in your heart that must be purified.
author: Erin Reese

text: Travel empties out everything you’ve into the box called your life, all the things you accumulate to tell you who you are
author: Claire Fontaine
